samples.questionContent:
**Match each periodic wave property with its description by dragging the tiles.**

[[☃ matcher 1]]

right: number of wave cycles that pass a point in a given amount of time
distance from the beginning of one wave cycle to the beginning of the next cycle
maximum change from equilibrium as a wave passes

samples.questionContent:
**Match the word to the sentence it best completes:**

[[☃ matcher 1]]

right: The town council passed new rules to  _\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ swimming in the lake. Now you can swim only when a lifeguard is on duty.
The conversation started in a friendly way but quickly became angry and _\_\_\_\_\_\_\_.
Listen to both sides of the argument before you decide which group to _\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ yourself with.
The smoke wafting through the restaurant led Enid to conclude that the city didn’t _\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ its law banning indoor tobacco use.

samples.questionContent:
**Complete the table by selecting the most likely type of organism for each characteristic.**

Characteristic | Type of organism
- | :-:
narrow niche | [[☃ dropdown 1]]
broad niche | [[☃ dropdown 2]]
has large tolerance ranges for abiotic factors | [[☃ dropdown 3]]
has small tolerance ranges for abi...

left: This type of organism has a narrow niche.
This type of organism has a broad niche.
This type of organism has large tolerance ranges for abiotic factors in their environment.
This type of organism has small tolerance ranges for abiotic factors in their environment.

samples.questionContent:
**Match each cell part with its function.**

[[☃ matcher 1]]

right: regulates what enters and exits the cell
modifies and sorts molecules for transport

samples.questionContent:
A single ticket to the magic show costs $t$ dollars, but there is a discount of $5\%$ per ticket if a group buys $10$ tickets.

The expression $10t-10\cdot 0.05t$ describes the total cost of buying $10$ tickets for a group.

**Match each amount in the situation with the expression that represents it...

**Match each statement with its definition:**

[[☃ matcher 1]]

left: A statement given in support of some other statement(s).
A set of statements that together comprise a reason for a further statement
A statement supported by some other statement(s).

samples.questionContent:
The number line shows the freezing points of water and carbon dioxide in degrees Celsius ($\degree \text{C}$).

[[☃ image 1]]

**Match the values to their meaning.**


[[☃ matcher 1]]

right: Difference between the freezing points of water and carbon dioxide

samples.questionContent:
A wrecking ball hanging from a crane is pulled up and away from a wall by a cable. The cable is released and the ball swings down. The ball smashes a hole in the wall.

[[☃ image 5]]

**Analyze the energy of the ball-Earth system throughout this process. Then match each event below with its associat...

left: the ball swings down after the cable is released
the ball smashes into the wall

samples.questionContent:
**Without using a calculator, order the following expressions from least to greatest.**

[[☃ sorter 1]]

**Match the clocks to the correct time.**

[[☃ matcher 1]]

right: ![A clock shows the short hour hand points to 6. The long minute hand points to 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/854130232b1e37bf6bf5c35b5f7dec27ba7564eb)
![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 12 and 1. The long minute hand points to 6.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3f3bbffe3df3eee168d13a8d1ced9fed79267b32)
![A clock shows the short hour hand points to 12. The long minute hand points to 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/536421819122ae3776c04ca58ffa474e0c3a779b)
